meaningMnemonic: An <kanji>eternity</kanji> that is <kanji>far</kanji> away is not really an eternity, it just feels like it. It's <vocabulary>forever</vocabulary>, but not the real kind of forever that's actually forever. That's 永久, which is a real forever, this is more like "whoa, I haven't eaten sushi in forever" (actually, you have).
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
